item.title: Features
item.description: Database features encompass functionalities offered by database management systems (DBMS) to manage data effectively. Here’s a breakdown of some prominent features: Data Structuring and Manipulation: Data Definition Language (DDL): This language allows you to create, modify, and remove the structure of a database, including tables, columns, and constraints. Data Manipulation Language (DML): This is the workhorse for interacting with data. DML commands like INSERT, UPDATE, and DELETE enable you to add, modify, and remove data within the database.
